name: Player Non Player
description:
Explore a melancholic island with brutalist structures where you'll ​encounter ​4 tormented characters. ​Gradually understand their desires through a surprising puzzle/dating sim gameplay by caressing or holding the characters. ​Will they trust you enough to ask you one last thing?

Also find the island’s secrets, play with the sound structures or walk around and listen to the musical landscapes. Enjoy easter eggs with the french voices of Françoise Cadol, Donald Reignoux, and Pierre-Alain de Garrigues!




​Player Non Player is a queer game created by Jonathan Coryn that explores mature themes, such as grief, through the lens of intimacy, including sexual and gender identity, friendship and love. ​Released alongside Agar Agar's new album of the same name, the video game shares a unified lore, with the music intricately tied to the game's narrative. Notably, the "Trouble" music clip serves as a prequel to the events depicted in the game.
